intro: Uvaria ambongoensis var. ambongoensis, commonly known as the Ambongo uvaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the wet season. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, providing a dense canopy in its natural habitat. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
